verses.verse: Now while Ezra<WH5830> prayed<WH6419> and made confession<WH3034>, weeping<WH1058> and casting himself down<WH5307> before<WH6440> the house<WH1004> of God<WH430>, there was gathered<WH6908> together unto him out of Israel<WH3478> a very<WH3966> great<WH7227> assembly<WH6951> of men<WH582> and women<WH802> and children<WH3206>; for the people<WH582> wept<WH1058> very<WH7235> sore<WH1059>.

And Shecaniah<WH7935> the son<WH1121> of Jehiel<WH3171>, one of the sons<WH1121> of Elam<WH5867>, answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> unto Ezra<WH5830>, We have trespassed<WH4603> against our God<WH430>, and have married<WH3427> foreign<WH5237> women<WH802> of the peoples<WH5971> of the land<WH776>: yet now there is<WH3426> hope<WH4723> for Israel concerning this thing<WH3478>.

Now therefore let us make<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with our God<WH430> to put away<WH3318> all the wives<WH802>, and such as are born<WH3205> of them<WH6098>, according to the counsel of my lord<WH136>, and of those that tremble<WH2730> at the commandment<WH4687> of our God<WH430>; and let it be done<WH6213> according to the law<WH8451>.
Arise <WH6965>; for the matter<WH1697> belongeth unto thee<WH2388>, and we are with thee: be of good courage, and do it<WH6213>.

Then arose<WH6965> Ezra<WH5830>, and made the chiefs<WH8269> of the priests<WH3548>, the Levites<WH3881>, and all Israel<WH3478>, to swear<WH7650> that they would do<WH6213> according to this word<WH1697>. So they sware<WH7650>.

Then Ezra<WH5830> rose up<WH6965> from before<WH6440> the house<WH1004> of God<WH430>, and went<WH3212> into the chamber<WH3957> of Jehohanan<WH3076> the son<WH1121> of Eliashib<WH475>: and when he came<WH3212> thither<WH398>, he did eat no bread<WH3899>, nor drink<WH8354> water<WH4325>; for he mourned<WH56> because of the trespass<WH4604> of them of the captivity<WH1473>.

And they made proclamation<WH5674> throughout Judah<WH3063> and Jerusalem<WH3389> unto all the children<WH1121> of the captivity<WH1473>, that they should gather themselves together<WH6908> unto Jerusalem<WH3389>;

and that whosoever came<WH935> not within three<WH7969> days<WH3117>, according to the counsel<WH6098> of the princes<WH8269> and the elders<WH2205>, all his substance<WH7399> should be forfeited<WH2763>, and himself separated<WH914> from the assembly<WH6951> of the captivity<WH1473>.

Then all the men<WH582> of Judah<WH3063> and Benjamin<WH1144> gathered themselves together<WH6908> unto Jerusalem<WH3389> within the three<WH7969> days<WH3117>; it was the ninth<WH8671> month<WH2320>, on the twentieth<WH6242> day of the month<WH2320>: and all the people<WH5971> sat<WH3427> in the broad<WH7339> place before the house<WH1004> of God<WH430>, trembling<WH7460> because of this matter<WH1697>, and for the great rain<WH1653>.

And Ezra<WH5830> the priest<WH3548> stood up<WH6965>, and said<WH559> unto them<WH4603>, Ye have trespassed, and have married<WH3427> foreign<WH5237> women<WH802>, to increase<WH3254> the guilt<WH819> of Israel<WH3478>.

Now therefore make<WH5414> confession<WH8426> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of your fathers<WH1>, and do<WH6213> his pleasure<WH7522>; and separate<WH914> yourselves from the peoples<WH5971> of the land<WH776>, and from the foreign<WH5237> women<WH802>.
Then all the assembly<WH6951> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963>, As thou hast said<WH1697> concerning us<WH6213>, so must we do.

But <WH61> the people<WH5971> are many<WH7227>, and it is a time<WH6256> of much rain<WH1653>, and we are not able<WH3581> to stand<WH5975> without<WH2351>: neither is this a work<WH4399> of one<WH259> day<WH3117> or two<WH8147>; for we<WH7235> have greatly transgressed<WH6586> in this matter<WH1697>.

Let now our princes<WH8269> be appointed<WH5975> for all the assembly<WH6951>, and let all them that are in our cities<WH5892> that have married<WH3427> foreign<WH5237> women<WH802> come<WH935> at appointed<WH2163> times<WH6256>, and with them the elders<WH2205> of every city<WH5892>, and the judges<WH8199> thereof<WH2740>, until the fierce wrath<WH639> of our God<WH430> be turned<WH7725> from us<WH1697>, until this matter be despatched.

Only Jonathan<WH3129> the son<WH1121> of Asahel<WH6214> and Jahzeiah<WH3167> the son<WH1121> of Tikvah<WH8616> stood<WH5975> up against this matter<WH4918>: and Meshullam and Shabbethai<WH7678> the Levite<WH3881> helped them<WH5826>.

And the children<WH1121> of the captivity<WH1473> did so<WH6213>. And Ezra<WH5830> the priest<WH3548>, with certain<WH582> heads<WH7218> of fathers<WH1>' houses<WH1004>, after their fathers<WH1>' houses<WH8034>, and all of them by their names, were set apart<WH914>; and they sat down<WH3427> in the first<WH259> day<WH3117> of the tenth<WH6224> month<WH2320> to examine<WH1875> the matter<WH1697>.
And they made an end<WH3615> with all the men<WH582> that had married<WH3427> foreign<WH5237> women<WH802> by the first<WH259> day<WH3117> of the first<WH7223> month<WH2320>.

And among the sons<WH1121> of the priests<WH3548> there were found<WH4672> that had married<WH3427> foreign<WH5237> women<WH802>: namely<WH1121>, of the sons of Jeshua<WH3442>, the son<WH1121> of Jozadak<WH3136>, and his brethren<WH251>, Maaseiah<WH4641>, and Eliezer<WH461>, and Jarib<WH3402>, and Gedaliah<WH1436>.
And they gave<WH5414> their hand<WH3027> that they would put away<WH3318> their wives<WH802>; and being guilty<WH818>, they offered a ram<WH352> of the flock<WH6629> for their guilt<WH819>.
